measured_by: Two graph-related comprehension questions per graph
justification: The article specifies that 'Two items assessed comprehension for each graph,' where participants answered questions related to the graph while looking at it, indicating that these questions were used to measure comprehension.

measured_by: Correlation between confidence in comprehension and actual comprehension
justification: The paper describes awareness of graph comprehension as 'measured by assessing the relationship between confidence in graph comprehension and the graph comprehension score,' showing this link through correlations in the results section.
Participants rated their cognitive load required to understand each graph on a scale, suggesting this method was used to measure the mental effort associated with interpreting the redesigned graphs.
In Study 1, participants rated their satisfaction with the graph using a scale from 0% to 100%, indicating this measure was used to assess subjective satisfaction with the graph design.
